"A.P.239/5/4": "Ah, it's you. I'm glad to see you again."
"I'm growing bored of watching Eu and that boy over there do nothing but sulk and pout."
"This planet is boring, too. Sand, sand and more sand, as far as the eye can see. What a desolate place."
"What was this planet called again, Lillipa? Hmmmmm... Was that one of the planets we controlled?"
"Hey, [Apprentice], cough up some answers already. What did you mean earlier when you said the [Profound Darkness] appeared \"again\"?"
"Firstly, it's not \"Apprentice\". My name is Aurora. Don't make that mistake again, Eu."
"And I think what I said was clear enough. You have heard of the [Profound Darkness] that was born in the era of the Photoners, yes?"
"Indeed, the [Profound Darkness] was created by we Photoners. And its birth caused us great difficulties."
"Nobody expected our experiments to produce such a result. But when it emerged, we worked tirelessly to come up with countermeasures that would let us seal it away."
"You sealed it away? How in the world did you manage that?"
"Hm? Let me think... Ah, yes. I wasn't involved in it myself, you see..."
"But as I understand it, the [Profound Darkness] is hostile towards anyone that uses Photons, and will pursue them until it devours and erases them."
"And so, we channelled all of our Photons into a single person, and sealed them away along with the [Profound Darkness]."
"Sorry, you... forced all your Photons into one person? And sealed them away? I don't understand. Are you sure that's what happened?"
"As I said, I wasn't personally involved, but I was told that that was what happened by an Admiral whose word I trust implicitly."
"...That's sick."
"Sick? How so? One person's life to save an entire universe is more than a fair trade, isn't it?"
"I figured you'd understand our way of thinking a little better, Eu. As a former [Apprentice] host, and all."
"Me...? Yeah, I guess I can see it. When I was [Apprentice], I wouldn't have thought twice about doing something like that."
"But that doesn't stop me feeling angry about it now."
"...Everything about me was being manipulated. Not just my memories, but my way of thinking too."

"...Well, the seal may have worked, but the Dark Falz still managed to come along and destroy our civilization anyway.
So much for our great victory."
"...You can say that again."

"I'm bored of this area.
Take me to another."
